pullRequest.body:
Part of #15524. (There will be more interesting krullDim lemma once we
add the full coheight api)

From the Carleson project.

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Can you explain the precise difference between the two statements? It's hard to make out from just staring at the code

Ah wait, this is parsed as
```suggestion
lemma krullDim_eq_iSup_height_of_nonempty [Nonempty Î±] : krullDim Î± = â†‘(â¨† a : Î±, height a) := by
```
Probably worth writing it like that, because one would expect the arrow to be pushed inside (and it might become so in the future)

```suggestion
`WithBot â„•âˆž` is on the outside of the right-hand side, which is usually more convenient.
```

```suggestion
The Krull dimension is the supremum of the elements' heights.
```

```suggestion
The Krull dimension is the supremum of the elements' coheights.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(KrullDimension): krullDim lemmas
